intro: Hieracium pictibifidum, commonly known as the painted devil's bit, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with distinctive black markings, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, often shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Hieracium pictibifidum is native to Europe and is often found in damp meadows and along riverbanks.
